00024 #define SQR(x)  ((x)*(x))
00025 
00026 
00027 double besselj0(double x)
00028 {
00029   const double EPSILON = 1E-8;
00030 
00031   if (fabs(x) < EPSILON)
00032     return (1.0 - SQR(x)/6.0);
00033   else
00034     return sin(x)/x;
00035 }

00038 complex double cbesselj0(complex double x)
00039 {
00040   const double EPSILON = 1E-8;
00041 
00042   if (cabs(x) < EPSILON)
00043     return (1.0 - SQR(x)/6.0);
00044   else
00045     return csin(x)/x;
00046 }
00047 
00048 
00049 // recursion upwards becomes numerically instable for |x| < l
00050 // for |x| > 0.5 they are ok for not too large l
00051 // for smaller x use taylor expansion 
00052 
00053 void besseljs(int lmax, double x, double* jl)
00054 {
00055   const double EPSILON = 0.5;
00056   double x2 = SQR(x);
00057 
00058   // low order Taylor for small x
00059   if (fabs(x) < EPSILON) {
00060     jl[0] = 1.0 - x2/6.0* (1.0+x2/20.0);
00061     for (int l=1; l<=lmax; l++)
00062       jl[l] = jl[l-1]*x/(2*l+1) *(1.0+x2/((2l+1)*(2l+3))* (1.0+x2/((2l+1)*(2l+5))));
00063   } else {
00064     jl[0] = sin(x)/x;
00065     if (lmax==0) return;
00066     jl[1] = (sin(x)-x*cos(x))/SQR(x);
00067     for (int l=2; l<=lmax; l++)
00068       jl[l] = (2*l-1)*jl[l-1]/x-jl[l-2];
00069   }
00070 }
00071

00073 void cbesseljs(int lmax, complex double x, complex double* jl)
00074 {
00075   const double EPSILON = 0.5;
00076   complex double x2 = SQR(x);
00077 
00078   // low order Taylor for small x
00079   if (cabs(x) < EPSILON) {
00080     jl[0] = 1.0 - x2/6.0* (1.0+x2/20.0);
00081     for (int l=1; l<=lmax; l++)
00082       jl[l] = jl[l-1]*x/(2*l+1) *(1.0+x2/((2l+1)*(2l+3))* (1.0+x2/((2l+1)*(2l+5))));
00083   } else {
00084     jl[0] = csin(x)/x;
00085     if (lmax==0) return;
00086     jl[1] = (csin(x)-x*ccos(x))/SQR(x);
00087     for (int l=2; l<=lmax; l++)
00088       jl[l] = (2*l-1)*jl[l-1]/x-jl[l-2];
00089   }
00090 }

00120 double besseli0(double x)
00121 {
00122   const double EPSILON = 1E-8;
00123 
00124   if (fabs(x) < EPSILON)
00125     return(1.0 + SQR(x)/6.0);
00126   else
00127     return sinh(x)/x;

00131 complex double cbesseli0(complex double x)

00142 
00143 // recursion upwards becomes numerically instable for |x| < l
00144 // for |x| > 0.5 they are ok for not too large l
00145 // for smaller x use taylor expansion 
00146 
00147 void besselis(int lmax, double x, double* il)
00148 {
00149   const double EPSILON = 0.5;
00150   double x2 = SQR(x);
00151 
00152   // Taylor expansion for small x
00153   if (fabs(x) < EPSILON) {
00154     il[0] = 1.0 + x2/6.0* (1.0+x2/20.0);
00155     for (int l=1; l<=lmax; l++)
00156       il[l] = il[l-1]*x/(2*l+1)*(1.0-x2/((2l+1)*(2l+3))*(1.0-x2/((2l+1)*(2l+5))));
00157   } else {
00158     il[0] = sinh(x)/x;
00159     if (lmax==0) return;
00160     il[1] = -(sinh(x)-x*cosh(x))/x2;
00161     for (int l=2; l<=lmax; l++)
00162       il[l] = -(2*l-1)*il[l-1]/x+il[l-2];
00163   }
00164 }
00165 
00166 
00167 void cbesselis(int lmax, complex double x, complex double* il)
00168 {
00169   const double EPSILON = 0.5;
00170   complex double x2 = SQR(x);
00171 
00172   // Taylor expansion for small x
00173   if (cabs(x) < EPSILON) {
00174     il[0] = 1.0 + x2/6.0* (1.0+x2/20.0);
00175     for (int l=1; l<=lmax; l++)
00176       il[l] = il[l-1]*x/(2*l+1)*(1.0-x2/((2l+1)*(2l+3))*(1.0-x2/((2l+1)*(2l+5))));
00177   } else {
00178     il[0] = csinh(x)/x;
00179     if (lmax==0) return;
00180     il[1] = -(csinh(x)-x*ccosh(x))/x2;
00181     for (int l=2; l<=lmax; l++)
00182       il[l] = -(2*l-1)*il[l-1]/x+il[l-2];
00183   }
00184 }
